p: It should be noted that other factors apart from ENSO can also result in changes of precipitation amount, frequency, and intensity. Variability in precipitation events have also been attributed to an increasing hydroclimatic intensity which can lead to shorter and less frequent precipitation events 33. Global projections of changes in precipitation and aridity (defined as the ratio of total annual precipitation to potential evapotranspiration) have highlighted the risk of land degradation 34 which can further increase uncertainties associated with agricultural production and food security.
